name: Stauntons on the Green

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an excellent location - close to Merrion Sq, Temple Bar and St. Stephen's on the Green. We were welcomed to the hotel by Sarah, who invited us to go down to breakfast even though our check in was for later that day. We were beat from our trip from NYC to Dublin and asked if we can relax in the waiting room and were kindly accommodated. Looking through some tour books, I went to Sarah to ask her a question and she kindly told me that the people who were in our room before us had checked out early and our room would be ready in 20 minutes! The hotel did not need to check us in early. But we are glad they did.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast at the hotel was filling.
reviews.title: A nice location in a centralish part of Dublin

reviews.text: The bed was comfortable. The shower fantastic.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The location amazing.
reviews.title: Great situation for central Dublin

reviews.text: The staff - there are no words to say how fantastic the staff at stauntons on the green is.
reviews.title: Great location
Hated to Say Goodbye
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 5-night stay at charming Staunton's on the Green. Great location on St. Stephen's Green, near Grafton St. shopping and many pubs and restaurants. The inn itself is a little shabby but, as others have noted, that's part of its charm. We had a nice double on the front facing the Green: street noise was minimal. The staff was terrific: friendly and warm. The Irish breakfast was delicious and included in the very reasonable rates. We hated to say goodbye, and would definitely stay here again.

Just returned from a 4 night stay at Staunton's -The location couldn't be better for all public transportation - we were just across the Green from a "Hop On-Hop Off" bus, and the airport bus was about 2 blocks away. Our room faced the back and was very quiet - it was large by European standards - 2 double beds, 2 huge windows and a fireplace (non-working) - We were on the second (3rd for Europe) floor and no lift... but our bags were delivered to our room and, again, on departure, were brought down for us. The bathroom was medium size, but no place to hang anything or set anything down. Water pressure was fine and it was clean!!
reviews.title: A Great B&B
No lift! Superb staff - small space!
reviews.text: The breakfasts were plain but plentiful - the staff was great! This was our first trip to Ireland, and the first hotel out of 4 for 14 days -- it couldn't have been a better start!

The staff in Stauntons were superb and were definitely, in my opinion, the best thing about this Guesthouse. Also, its location, across the road from the southern side of St. Stephen’s Green, along with its proximity to the Luas (Dublin’s tram system), is another favourable aspect of this accommodation. However, there are several aspects with which I was not satisfied.
reviews.title: Oh, dear!!
Not the best
reviews.text: Firstly, the fact that the accommodation does not have a lift, means that one has to drag bags and suitcases up and down stairs. Secondly, having been allocated a road-facing (St. Stephen's Green-facing) room, I had the sound of traffic permanently as background noise.

reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights Nov 19th and 20th 2004. Great location, just away from the hussle and bustle

reviews.title: Great stay, great location, good value
reviews.text: Staff very friendly, ask for room at the back (much quieter)

reviews.title: Good location, otherwise a very average hotel
reviews.text: Just few minutes walk through nice park to Grafton Street shopping area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stauntons on the Green is a boutique hotel that located along the south edge of St Stevens Green.
reviews.title: Convenient and quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fairly small and quaint - it is a historic building that has been expanded and repurposed as a hotel. We were there twice - at the beginning and end of a tour of Ireland, so we experienced two rooms (both in the new wing of the hotel). Our rooms were quite adequate for our purpose.
reviews.title: Good hotel on top location

reviews.text: A major selling point for Stauntons is the location. St Stevens Green is a major Georgian square on the south side of Dublin, and a great place to walk or, for those inclined, run. Be aware that the gates are locked from dusk to dawn. The tour buses have a stop on the north side of the Green, a short walk across the park from Stauntons. And the major shopping area along Grafton Street is only about five minutes away.
reviews.title: Outdated, Expensive but Top Location

reviews.text: Rooms are smallish but adequate. The staff is congenial. They offer free WiFi that is accessible throughout the building. Hot water is plentiful and bathrooms are equipped with heated towel bars. A complementary breakfast is provided with each room. Note that the cooked breakfast service commences at 8am, but a continental breakfast is available upon request for travelers who must leave earlier.
reviews.title: Good location but old, outdated, poor hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one concern is a pet peeve - the amount of space available in the bathroom for toiletries. There is very limited shelf space, so one must deal wit the problem of what to do with the dopp bag and all of its contents. One option is to use the top of the toilet (being sure to leave the lid closed!).
reviews.title: Not a good way to start and end a tour

reviews.text: The guest house is a in a great location and they don’t have to try very hard to attract guests. Unfortunately they don’t. Our room was nice, and on the ground floor. The guest house is located on the quiet side of the Green, so noise outside our window was limited to typical city sounds.
reviews.title: Great Location, needs better management.
Good hotel, but expensive
reviews.text: They shower had just a curtain and shower pan did not keep the water from running all over the bathroom floor. Even if you took great care in making sure the curtain was against the wall. It took two or three towels to dam up around the shower to keep the water from running on the floor.

The breakfast offered daily was terrible. The coffee was just bad. I tried the eggs different every day hoping I would get a properly cooked egg. I tried, fried, poached and scrambled-no joy! When you ordered your breakfast it came out fast-too fast. It all seemed prepared well ahead of time. The black pudding was overcooked daily.
reviews.title: Bad smell in room, not fresh, very unpleasant manager/receptionnist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do little things to see if places go the extra mile. I left a candy wrapper outside our door the first day. On the third day when we checked out it was still there. You would think at least one person on the staff walking by would have picked it up.
reviews.title: Extremely disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a quiet side of St. Steven's green, the hotel is in a Georgian building. Unfortunately, the carpet looks like it might be original Georgian and the floors creek, so you know when your upstairs neighbors are moving. I liked the hotel, but for the price, I think it is over rated. No dinner service in the hotel, so you need to walk quite a bit to get dinner. We went to Foley's on merrion row and had a good dinner.
reviews.title: Ideal location in the heart of Dublin city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our one night stay; we arrived via the airport bus (only 7 euros each way and the stop is just over a block away) to early to check in but the hotel was happy to hold our bags while we explored Dublin. The location is great - about a 5 minute walk from the main shopping area and only 10-15 minutes from Trinity College, Temple Bar, etc.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff, can't beat the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the hotel later in the day to find that our bags had been delivered to our room. Room was very comfortable with a large modern bath and plenty of hot water. Breakfast was good if unexceptional with fast & friendly service. No lifts and lots of stairs means you should pack light, but we found the staff very helpful and friendly and the location perfect - we would happily book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very happy

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights and could not have been happier. The location is perfect for walking anywhere in Dublin and the staff was very helpful with great recommendations for restaurants. Being right across the street from St. Stephens Green was a real treat and we enjoyed our walks through there everyday.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: Stayed here on my recent work visit to Dublin. It's a B&B and try not to expect much from here.
reviews.title: Quite Lovely

reviews.text: Even though the staff were quite welcoming, the rooms are really small like box rooms, very old fashioned, and really out dated. The room did stink of an old smell and the shower was dirty. No room service or anything.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

aka: Stauntons On The Green Hotel Dublin
